title: Suspected adultery without witnesses
vignette: A husband suspects his wife of infidelity but lacks evidence.

options.text: Pursue the Suspected Infidelity ritual to clarify.
Forgive privately and move on.

title: Drinking the bitter waters while pregnant
vignette: A woman suspected of adultery is already several months pregnant.

options.text: Proceed with the ritual despite pregnancy.
Delay until after birth for safety.

title: Confession before the ceremony
vignette: Right before the ritual, the woman admits wrongdoing in private.

options.text: Cancel the ceremony and impose divorce.
Continue publicly as planned.

title: Husband reluctant to bring to central complex
vignette: The husband worries the ritual will humiliate his wife even if innocent.

options.text: Seek private reconciliation instead.
Insist on the public ceremony.

title: Witness recants accusation
vignette: A sole witness to possible adultery later admits he might have been mistaken.

options.text: Drop the case due to uncertainty.
Proceed since suspicion remains.

title: Husband abroad for long period
vignette: A husband abroad hears rumors about his wife and wants the ritual administered.

options.text: Delay until he returns to confront her.
Allow local authorities to act in his absence.

title: Coerced participation in the ritual
vignette: Community leaders pressure an uncertain husband to force the ceremony.

options.text: He should decide freely without coercion.
Yield to their pressure and proceed.

title: Publicizing the outcome
vignette: After the ritual clears the woman, neighbors gossip about the incident.

options.text: Publicize her innocence to stop rumors.
Keep details private to respect her dignity.

title: Offering financial settlement instead
vignette: To avoid the ceremony, the wife offers a monetary settlement for divorce.

options.text: Accept the settlement and grant divorce.
Insist on the ritual first.

title: Multiple accusations in one town
vignette: Several women are accused around the same time, overwhelming the court.

options.text: Stagger the rituals to reduce public spectacle.
Hold all ceremonies quickly for deterrence.

title: Husband's jealousy without cause
vignette: A suspicious husband keeps accusing his wife without any evidence or warning.

options.text: Counsel him to stop and trust her.
Proceed with the ceremony to reassure him.

title: Wife refuses to drink
vignette: At the last moment, the woman refuses to drink the bitter waters.

options.text: Force the issue and make her drink.
End the process and finalize divorce instead.

title: Crowd disrupting the ceremony
vignette: Spectators jeer loudly during the Suspected Infidelity ritual, embarrassing all involved.

options.text: Clear the crowd to maintain dignity.
Let them remain as a warning to others.

title: Recording the ceremony
vignette: Officials want to record the ritual for training purposes.

options.text: Record discreetly for educational use.
Do not record to protect privacy.

title: Restoring the marriage afterward
vignette: After being cleared, the couple wonders if they can rebuild trust.

options.text: Encourage reconciliation and start anew.
Advise separation despite innocence.
